arch:property.oc:show_val: 2.0 m north south-by-2.90 m east west.
North end W CP East, area of robbed pavers (Tr. 97, 2004, Locus 23).

A leveling course of generally flat, dry laid stones that are tightly fitted together. The course includes rough hewn boulders, wadi/field stones, and a single sandstone ashlar in reuse (AF-2, Seq. No. SP105030). Embedded between two of the stones a coin (SF-11, Seq. No. SP105068) was recovered.
Phase V: Late Nabataean CE 1st c. redesign and repairs.
